content:
This was working, but I notice it is not working on our current version V5.14.

I expected to see both the published and DRAFT version of a dataset in MyData - like image below on Demo Dataverse (so so maybe it was fixed in V6), but I only see the published version in my local Dataverse repo (V5.14) - I have to go to the dataset and look under the "Version" tab to get to the draft:

Screenshot-2024-03-27-at-1.18.05-PM.png

UPDATE.....
But it Seems to be working for other datasets.... why would some datasets not show both DRAFT & Published versions
Huh. Weird. Maybe indexing failed? What if you make a minor change to the draft and save it? Does the MyData "card" show up?
Ok... it could be indexing problem... the dataset that was published is now in draft w/ two new 300+GB files.

Sherry Lake said:

Ok... it could be indexing problem... the dataset that was published is now in draft w/ two new 300+GB files.

Do you by chance have full-text indexing enabled?

Let me check - The files uploaded are 3D "fls" or a zip file. So would full-text even try?

But I don't know if I have it enabled.
@Sherry Lake are you using a dataset template?

Philip Durbin said:

Sherry Lake are you using a dataset template?

No, this collection is not using a dataset template.

Don Sizemore said:

Sherry Lake said:

Ok... it could be indexing problem... the dataset that was published is now in draft w/ two new 300+GB files.

Do you by chance have full-text indexing enabled?

[Solr] Full Text Indexing is "false".
closing this for now. Working on large file validation problems (or not a problem, can't tell yet).
Sherry Lake has marked this topic as resolved.
